importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The date of the article's publication, indicating when the firing of Ange Postecoglou was confirmed and reported by CNN.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The extremely short tenure of Ange Postecoglou at Nottingham Forest, marking the shortest managerial stint in Premier League history, highlights the abruptness of the decision and raises questions about performance and club governance.

keyTakeAways: Ange Postecoglou was dismissed by Nottingham Forest just 39 days after being appointed, making it the shortest managerial tenure in Premier League history.
Postecoglou failed to win any of his 9 matches, with only two draws and six losses during his time at the club.
The dismissal followed a 3-0 defeat to Chelsea, the final match of a disastrous start to the season.
The decision comes just days after the previous manager, Nuno Espírito Santo, was fired, signaling instability at the club.
The firing is considered one of the fastest in Premier League history, faster than Les Reed’s exit at Charlton Athletic in 2006.
Sam Allardyce is noted as the only permanent manager with a shorter tenure, though he left by mutual consent.
Postecoglou's appointment was seen as a significant move, given his success at Tottenham and Celtic, but his failure to deliver results led to immediate dismissal.
Fans booed him at the end of the final match, indicating strong public backlash and a lack of fan support.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Ange Postecoglou, the Australian football manager previously successful at Tottenham and Celtic, was fired by Nottingham Forest just 39 days after being appointed, marking the shortest managerial tenure in Premier League history. His dismissal follows a dismal start to the season, including a 3-0 defeat to Chelsea, with no wins in nine matches and only two draws. The club, which had just seen Nuno Espírito Santo fired after a strong season, now faces its third managerial change in the season, highlighting instability in leadership. The decision is notable not only for its brevity but also for the public backlash, with fans booing Postecoglou at the final match. The situation echoes past managerial records, with Sam Allardyce being the only permanent manager with a shorter tenure, and sets a new benchmark for managerial performance expectations in the Premier League.
title: Ange Postecoglou Fired by Nottingham Forest After 39 Days
